sub_topic: Identifying the maximum independent set in a graph.
message_1:
What is the maximum number of independent vertices that can be selected from the following graph?

```
    A --- B
   /|\    |
  / | \   |
 C--D--E--F
    |
    |
    G
```

(Note: "Independent" means that the selected vertices cannot be adjacent, i.e., they are not connected by an edge.)
message_2: To find the maximum number of independent vertices, we need to select vertices that are not connected by an edge. In this graph, one possible selection of independent vertices is {A, C, F, G}. Another possible selection is {B, D, E}. Both of these selections have 4 independent vertices, so the maximum number of independent vertices that can be selected from this graph is 4.
